comments.body: I suppose another option would be to retrieve this from GitHub, but this works just as well.

One difference is that the distribution release have already the configuration file. Otherwise we need to run `autogen.sh`.

Would you prefer github snapshots?

In the case of #2348, the distribution release contains a snapshot of the plugins which are tracked via git submodules. When I tried to build from the github snapshot I found that some submodules references are missing, thus failing to update the plugins' libraries.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +11,15 @@source:
  fn: {{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.bz2
  url: https://bintray.com/{{ author }}/generic/download_file?file_path={{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  {{ hash_type }}: {{ hash_val }}

comments.body: Forgot to ask. Do you know if the `snappy` version needs to match `snzip` version or not?
